{"id":301211792,"lang":"c","lang_name":"C","time":"3 years, 7 months","timestamp":1581131377,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"16 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/301211792/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"9.1 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     struct ListNode *next;\n * };\n */\n\nvoid push(struct ListNode* head, int val) {\n    struct ListNode* current = head;\n    while(current->next != NULL) {\n        current = current->next;\n    }\n    current->next = (struct ListNode*) malloc(sizeof(struct ListNode));\n    current->next->val = val;\n    current->next->next = NULL;\n    current = current->next;\n}\n\nstruct ListNode* addTwoNumbers(struct ListNode* l1, struct ListNode* l2){\n    // init empty linked list for output\n    struct ListNode* head = (struct ListNode*) malloc(sizeof(struct ListNode));\n    head->next = NULL;\n    // init pointers to parameters\n    struct ListNode *p = l1, *q = l2, *current = head;\n    \n    int carry = 0;\n    while(p != NULL || q != NULL) {\n        int x = 0, y = 0;\n        if(p != NULL) { x = p->val; }\n        if(q != NULL) { y = q->val; }\n        int sum = carry + x + y;        // 0 <= sum < 20\n        carry = sum / 10;              // carry = 0 or 1\n        push(current, sum % 10);\n        if(p != NULL) { p = p->next; }\n        if(q != NULL) { q = q->next; }\n    }\n    if (carry > 0) { push(current, carry); }\n    return head->next;\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
